column4: I am tryin to install matlab and it is 3 disk, so when it ask for the the second disk it wil not unlock the cdrom so the disk can be inserted.  Has anyone had a similar problem or know of a solution
can you manually eject either by pressing the eject button or by entering "eject"
It will not let me manuall eject.
try "sudo eject." and did "eject" give you an error?
Yes it will not let me eject until i close the terminal that i am running the install script in
hmm. that's odd. sorry, i've got nothing more for you
Do you know of anyway to release a executable from a shell?
control-c
will forcibly kill it
I do not want to kill it i just want the script to run not in the terminal
you want it to run in the background, then?
exactly
thanks for your help
i hope it actually helped
That did not work either, but when i try to eject or sudo eject is just says device is busy
ahhh...hm. is this a native port of matlab?
yes
yeah...sorry, i don't know
I guess i will search matlabs forums for a solution or call them? but thanks for all your help
sorry it didn't help. good luck.
there is always octave and it is free
sweet. good luck!
